snippet: The inquiry, which places a focus on DraftKings, began after players and lawmakers described predatory tactics and questioned the use of inside information, according to players who said they were contacted.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and JACQUELINE WILLIAMS

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation opens inquiry into accusations that fantasy sports websites are using predatory tactics and leaking inside information; investigation focuses on misdeeds at DraftKings and FanDuel websites, including allegations that sites' employees use inside information to win largest prizes.
lead_paragraph: The inquiry, which places a focus on DraftKings, began after players and lawmakers described predatory tactics and questioned the use of inside information, according to players who said they were contacted.

headline.print_headline: Fantasy Sports Said to Attract F.B.I. Scrutiny
headline.main: Fantasy Sports Said to Attract F.B.I. Scrutiny
